forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. Low around 50, with temperatures rising to around 56 overnight. South southwest wind around 26 mph, with gusts as high as 52 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 1pm, then showers and thunderstorms. Cloudy. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 55 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 22 to 25 mph, with gusts as high as 48 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between three quarters and one inch possible.

weather_report:
As dawn gently breaks over Downtown San Francisco, the city is cloaked in a thick shroud of rain-spattered clouds, delivering an atmosphere both moody and invigorating. The relentless rain drapes the streets with a refreshing coolness, while the wind howls a brisk tune, stirring the mind and soul. Despite the view being obscured by grey skies, the rhythmic patter of raindrops offers a soothing backdrop, inviting one to remain indoors, cradled in warmth. Visibility may falter, but the vibrant city feels alive, the glimmer of the wet pavement reflecting the rallying spirit of San Francisco.  

Throughout the day, the rain will persist, intermingling with sporadic thunderstorms. Clad in layers, a waterproof jacket and sturdy shoes will maintain comfort against the elements. The promise of a warm beverage in hand might very well enhance your exploration of the city's vibrant cafés or local bookstores, where the scent of fresh coffee meets the romance of printed pages. As afternoon sets in, the temperatures will drop slightly, providing an opportunity to savor the cozy transitions of indoor life against the cocktail of weather outside, a dance between windswept rain and the ever-present energy of the city.
